What is Ku-band pencil beam scatterometer?
The Ku-band pencil beam scatterometer is an active microwave radar operating at 13.515 GHz providing a ground resolution cell of size 25 x 25 km.

What does dual frequency microwave radiometer do in SARAL satellites?

The SARAL payload includes the following components: An Altimeter, provided by CNES - the main mission instrument and a dual frequency microwave radiometer, provided by CNES - to correct the altimeter measurement for atmospheric range delays induced by water vapor.

What is MOSDAC?
MOSDAC is the short form of Meteorological and Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Center. It is an ISRO data portal which provides data through its web based service https://mosdac.gov.in.

What factors determine life cycle of convective cloud systems?

Many interactions between radiation, water vapour, clouds, precipitation, and atmospheric motion determine the life cycle of convective cloud systems, and the occurrence of extreme events like tropical cyclones, monsoons, floods, and droughts.

What are INSAT and INSAT-3DR?

INSAT (Indian National Satellite System) is a series of multipurpose geostationary satellites launched by ISRO to support telecommunications, broadcasting, meteorology, and search and rescue needs of India. INSAT-3DR is a multipurpose geosynchronous spacecraft with meteorological payloads providing operational environmental and storm warning services to protect life and property, and is used for earth surface monitoring, oceanic observations, and data dissemination.

What is the Imager?
The Imager is an improved design of the Very High Resolution Radiometer (VHRR-2) heritage instrument flown on Kalpana-1.
